We refer to Wikipedia articles on psychology for help. Dr. Louise Fryer is introduced as a presenter for BBC Radio 3, an audio describer at the National Theatre, and a vocal coach. Her academic background includes an MSc and a PhD in psychology. She also has experience as an actress. Therefore, the timeline should be 4 -> 5 -> 6 -> 2 -> 1 -> 3.

Therefore, the answer is (B).

The correct order is: (3) She demonstrates prosody with the phrase “I killed your wife,” showing how emphasis changes meaning. (2) She states audio description is “part and parcel” of accessibility. (1) The interviewer cites his 2016 book title and asks, “What is audio description?” (4) She explains theater audio introductions and how they were adapted to film after testing with blind viewers. (5) She defines audio subtitles as voicing written subtitles in multilingual films. (6) She recounts a blind person not noticing the description due to immersion, concluding good description shouldn’t draw attention to itself. (7) She discusses future personalization options and agrees audio description can help language learning, ending with mutual thanks. (8) With a horse-pattern cushion visible, she says the describer’s voice should be emotionally engaged, not robotic. (9) She defines audio description as commentary added to visual media for people who can’t see images.

Therefore, the answer is A: 3 -> 9 -> 5 -> 4 -> 6 -> 8 -> 1 -> 2 -> 7.
